unclouded

Uncloud your mind and step into a space designed for clarity, comfort, and gentle guidance. Whether you're navigating new feelings, seeking answers, or supporting someone else, this site offers clear, compassionate guidance for every stage of the mental health journey. We’re here to support you.

Your thoughts matter. Your wellbeing matters. And every small step is a meaningful one. Browse the sections below for mental health info and support, discover positive affirmations or read about other users experiences with unclouded. For even more support, sign up to our email newsletter below!

Sign Up

Information

Noticing when things feel off


Sometimes we or people around us might not feel quite like themselves. These gentle shifts deserve attention and care.


These shifts could look like:


  • Withdrawing from usual activities or people
  • Feeling persistently low, anxious, or overwhelmed
  • Changes in sleep, appetite, or energy levels
  • Difficulty concentrating or making decisions
  • Expressing hopelessness or persistent self-criticism

Being there for someone


Offering support doesn’t require expertise—just kindness and presence.


Ways to help:


  • Listen without judgment or the need to fix
  • Let them know you care, even in small ways
  • Avoid saying “just cheer up” or “it could be worse”
  • Encourage professional help if they seem open
  • Be patient—healing isn’t linear

A simple “I’m here for you, no matter what” goes a long way

How to get support


If things feel heavy, there is help—gentle, respectful, and tailored to different needs. You’re not alone in this.


Support might include:


  • Talking to a GP or mental health professional
  • Accessing therapy or counselling, in person or online
  • Joining peer support groups or wellness communities
  • Using mental health apps for mood tracking and mindfulness
  • Asking a trusted friend or mentor to help you take the first step

Helpful resources


Here’s a list of trusted places to explore mental health information and get support:


  • Mind UK - Mental health support, guidance & helpline mind.org
  • Samaritans - 24/7 listening support for anyone in distress samaritans.org
  • YoungMinds - Support for young people & parents youngminds.org
  • NHS Mental Health Services - Information and referral pathways in the UK nhs.uk
  • Mental Health Foundation - Advice, prevention tips & awareness tools mentalhealth.org

Affirmations

Stories

Click on the buttons below to read about real experiences from people who found clarity and support through unclouded. Their stories remind us that we’re not alone, and that seeking help is a sign of strength. We are proud to have been part of their journeys and would be honored to be a part of yours.

Amina's Story

“When I felt lost in my thoughts, unclouded gave me clarity. The language was gentle, the advice compassionate. It helped me find strength in my silence. I recommend it to every friend who’s struggling.”

Dev's Story

“unclouded reminded me that seeking help isn’t weakness — it’s courage. I found tools that actually made sense and helped. Their resources made me feel seen as a young carer. I won’t stop sharing it with my mates.”

Nia's Story

“I stumbled onto unclouded at 2am. It felt like someone finally understood me. The site has this calm energy that makes heavy thoughts easier to carry. I now include it in every wellbeing workshop I run.”

Leo's Story

“Navigating emotions post-injury was overwhelming. But unclouded simplified things — I didn’t feel like a ‘case,’ just a person. It’s the first space that felt welcoming and real. I’m proud to support it openly.”

Whether you’re seeking guidance, inspiration, or simply a gentle check-in, you can choose the email frequency that suits your needs. You’re in control.
